results.title: My dad
results.creator_credit: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fan Chen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.
description_for_label: In China where they lived in rather poor conditions, Fan Chen’s father worked hard to support his family and provide a better life for them, eventually making the move to Australia in 2006. This story is a ‘thank you’ from his admiring son.

results.title: The Wolf
results.creator_credit: Beverly Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was Beverly Bailey’s husband who suggested she take the trip to England and Canada to meet his family. As Bailey disappeared through the airport door her husband wondered if he’d said the wrong thing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Little something about us
results.creator_credit: Sze Ching Lee and School of Creative Arts, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Interviews with several young women from diverse Asian backgrounds who, through pixellated images, share their aspirations, interests, and love-hate relationships with Mellbourne, the city that has adopted them.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sze Ching Lee and School of Creative Arts, University of Melbourne

results.title: Grumpy old man
results.creator_credit: Richard Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Richard Bailey has nudged and niggled people and he’s had some success, especially on the asbestos issue. A heart attack in 2003 meant that Bailey couldn’t be as active anymore, so he decided to direct his energies elsewhere.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Where my heart lies
results.creator_credit: Vicki Baker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Vicki Baker, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Vicki Baker, mother of three, grew up in the bush but eventually had to move to town to find employment. She recalls her childhood days of family and the freedom of running through the bush with the wind in her hair and not a care in the world.

results.title: In memory of Mark and Dusty
results.creator_credit: Denise Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denise Thompson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: It is ten years since the tragic passing of Denise Thompson’s son Mark and the family dog Dusty. A loving tribute by a mother to her son and the pet dog he gave her when he was little.

results.title: I spell I can't...I can!
results.creator_credit: Edie Collet, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edie Collet’s beginnings were difficult - her mother died giving birth and she was diagnosed as being handicapped. Collet was raised by her father and siblings to become an educated, well travelled and independent adult. Collet was told she would never work but she proved them wrong. This story is dedicated to Collet’s dad.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edie Collet, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Days of clear water
results.creator_credit: Emma Case, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Emma describes her life growing up with her nan, an independent lady who loved to tend to her garden and go for walks along the river. When her nan passed away, Emma lost not only her nan but her best friend.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emma Case, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Little bit of willpower
results.creator_credit: Leanda Bunn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Kicked out of home at the age of 15 and struggling with depression, Leanda Bunn still managed to complete her VCE, find accommodation and be independent thanks to a few very special people in her life and a lot of willpower.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leanda Bunn, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
